Delete results in all tools? Dashboard A message from the developer One-Tap Mode Start scan and deletion for all tools with a tap on the dashboard\'s action button, no extra confirmations. One-Tap Tools Which tools should be included in one-tap operations?
Size Compressed size Debug notifications Recorded log file Recording debug log Record debug log Stop recording The generated file contains sensitive information (e.g. file names and installed apps). Only share it with trusted parties. This feature records everything the app is doing into a shareable file. The generated file contains sensitive information (e.g. file names and installed apps). Only share it with trusted parties (e.g. a developer that is troubleshooting an issue).
Active tasks SD Maid is working
%d active task
%d active tasks
%d task in queue
%d queued tasks
Task results Task result
Welcome SD Maid SE manages files, apps and storage. Gain storage space by cleaning up behind other apps. Delete expendable files and remove leftover data. This is a beta (testing) build. Proceed with a sense of humor and a backup plan. Please report issues you encounter. Continue
SD Maid / SD Maid SE SD Maid SE (aka. SD Maid 2) is the successor to SD Maid (aka. SD Maid 1). A new app, optimized for modern Android. It\'s predecessor\'s architecture is over 7 years old and not designed for the challenges of newer Android versions. A complete redesign was necessary to continue development. Consider switching to SD Maid SE for improved results. SD Maid 1\'s \"pro status\" is unfortunately not transferable to SD Maid 2/SE. After 12 years of free updates, a new purchase is required to sustain development (feed the developer). Continue
Privacy SD Maid has no ads and does not sell user data. Bug reports are sent when errors occur and may contain details about apps and files on your device. Reports help me fix bugs and improve the app. Allow automatic bug reports These options can be changed in the settings. Continue
Setup SD Maid will search all accessible data areas. What is accessible depends on your device, Android version and granted permissions. Start using SD Maid by setting up access to areas that should be searched. Set up access
Privacy policy Handling data responsibly. Licenses Other
Generic filter Specific filter Sponsor development Become a patron and make continued development possible.
General General tweaks that affect the whole app. User interface
Theme mode The mode used when theming the app (e.g. night or day). Dark Light System
Theme style The color style used when theming the app. Default Material You
File previews Display file previews in all tools (e.g. image and video thumbnails).
App language Select a different language for SD Maid, independent of your system\'s default language. Currently: %s
Support Read documentation, report issues, chat with others or record debug logs. Documentation A public issue tracker for bug reports and feature requests. Issue tracker Install ID Automatic error reports are anonymous. Share your install ID if the developer needs to find your error reports. Debug log Record everything the app is doing into a text file that you can share. Discord A place to hang out in and ask questions.
Changelog Acknowledgements
Setup Setup is incomplete Finish SD Maid\'s setup to get better results. SD Maid is trying to fix setup issues. Dismiss Continue setup Setup Show setup screen again, including already completed items. Verifying setup completion and functionality.
Setup is incomplete Further set up is required to use this feature. Complete the remaining setup steps.
Storage access framework Improve results by granting SD Maid access to additional areas. In most cases the window will open with the correct path preselected. Entries turn green when access is granted. You selected the wrong path The Documents UI app is unavailable. It\'s a built-in system app and should be available on all Android devices.
Manage storage Allow SD Maid to manage your storage. Basic access to public storage, e.g. "Download/" and "DCIM/", but not always "Android/data".
Root access Should SD Maid use root access if it is available? Root access can be used to check additional system folders and private application data. Root access is ready. Waiting for root access. Use root access if available Don\'t use root access Only available on rooted devices. If you didn\'t make this modification, then your device is not rooted and this setting has no effect.
Shizuku Allow SD Maid to use Shizuku where possible to improve results and enable features. This setting has no effect if the Shizuku app is not set up on your device. Shizuku in combination with root access does not enable additional features, but it improves reliability. SD Maid will use it as fallback method. Shizuku link is ready. Waiting for link with Shizuku. Use Shizuku if available Don\'t use Shizuku
You can find the setup screen again via the settings menu. Permission granted Permission error
Usage statistics The usage statistics permission grants access to more app details. SD Maid uses it to determine additional cache sizes. Required for accessibility service based cache deletion.
Notifications Allow SD Maid to post notifications to inform you about on-going operations or important events. Notifications are used sparingly 🤞
This feature requires completing additional setup items: %s
Accessibility service The accessibility service allows SD Maid to interact with your screen and automate tedious actions, e.g. tapping \"Clear cache\" on multiple screens. SD Maid will not use the accessibility service without your consent, will always display a prominent (cancelable) indicator while active and will not use it to collect information. Accessibility service is enabled Accessibility service is disabled Accessibility service is running Service will be launched on demand Accessibility service is stopped The service is enabled, but not running. Toggle it off/on or reboot your device. Check that SD Maid is not being "optimized" by the system. If the service keeps getting disabled after a while, try enabling the "Auto Start" option for SD Maid in the system settings. Enable service and grant access Don\'t use accessibility service If you see a little icon on the screen edge, then you accidentally enabled the "shortcut" option. If you change your mind, you can alter this option again by going into settings and restarting the setup. Restricted settings Can\'t enable SD Maids accessibility service? Android 13+ may apply restrictions to apps not installed via Google Play. Lift these restrictions from the system\'s detail page for SD Maid. The option is in the context menu in the top right corner.
App inventory SD Maid needs to know which apps you have to find files that don\'t belong to any installed apps. Look for a permission called \"App list\" or \"Query all packages\".
The system provided an invalid list of installed apps (e.g. too few or some were missing). Go to system settings and allow SD Maid access to \"App list\".
SD Maid didn\'t find any data areas that can be scanned. Did you complete the setup? Data areas Reload data areas
Debug mode Enable test options and more verbose output. App will run slower and perform differently. Automatic bug reports Automatically reports issues, e.g. details on the app crashes so I can figure out why and fix it.
Tools Filter Risk level
CorpseFinder Data belonging to already removed apps. Adjust scan filters and risk levels. Include desirable remnants Files that you might want to keep, even if the app is uninstalled, e.g. photos you took or backups you created. Include common names Data with commonly used names, e.g. a folder \"Notes\" is owned by too many unknown apps. Uninstall watcher Automatically scan for remnants when an app removed. Automatic deletion Automatically delete any remnants related to the uninstalled app.
%1$d remnant found after uninstalling %2$s.
%1$d remnants found after uninstalling %2$s.
Clean up successful (%1$s): Freed %2$s and removed %3$d item.
Clean up successful (%1$s): Freed %2$s and removed %3$d items.
Delete remnants
Public media Public media files, e.g. files received via messenger apps. OBB resources Additional app resources, e.g. game assets. Public app data Non-sensitive app data, e.g. map caches. SD card General public storage, internal and external (e.g. SD cards). Private app data Private app data, e.g. credentials, app settings but also browser caches. Dalvik cache Cached app execution data. App libraries App related library data. App sources App installation data, i.e. where APKs go. Private app sources Restricted app installation data, e.g. protected third party apps. Encrypted app resources <string name="Can
